channel.title: Frequent Video Card Driver Crashes
channel.description:
I built the computer I'm on a while ago. I did it mainly for being able to play more games, but as it turns out, I can play even less. My video card is a Sapphire ATI RADEON HD 5770 1GB 128-bit GDDR5, bought from newegg.com:
http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16814102873&cm_re=radeon_hd_5770-_-14-102-873-_-Product
When I play games the screen will go black for a few seconds and then come back to the desktop with a balloon popup from the task bar saying the driver just recovered from a crash. Sometimes I even get a blue screen saying my computer was shutdown because the attempt to recover the driver timed out. I've already RMA'd this card once and it didn't help. I have no idea was going wrong. The driver it up to date an everything. Any ideas?

item.title: Frequent Video Card Driver Crashes
item.dc:creator: @B2300_T4nk B2300 T4nk
item.description:
@B2300_T4nk wrote:

I have ATI Radeon 5650 and it keeps on crashing too. I’m not in the US though

Read full topic

item.title: Frequent Video Card Driver Crashes
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

You should be able to get a refund for the card, bring in your computer to a best buy and have them match the best graphics card that will work with your computer, they do that for free if you buy the card.

Read full topic

item.title: Frequent Video Card Driver Crashes
item.dc:creator: @sp11k3t3ht3rd sp11k3t3ht3rd
item.description:
@sp11k3t3ht3rd wrote:

I’m thinking of just buying a new card. I just figured I’d post here to see if anyone knew what was wrong.

Read full topic
